definitions.definition: A place or locality , especially a centre of activity or the scene of a crime .
examples: The cafeteria was the locus of activity.

definitions.definition: The set of all points whose coordinates satisfy a given equation or condition .
examples: A circle is the locus of points from which the distance to the center is a given value, the radius.

definitions.definition: A fixed position on a string of DNA or RNA , especially a chromosome , that may be occupied by one or more genes .
A passage in writing , especially in a collection of ancient sacred writings arranged according to a theme .

main_definition: A place or locality , especially a centre of activity or the scene of a crime .
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) The set of all points whose coordinates satisfy a given equation or condition .
( genetics ) A fixed position on a string of DNA or RNA , especially a chromosome , that may be occupied by one or more genes .
( chiefly in the plural ) A passage in writing , especially in a collection of ancient sacred writings arranged according to a theme .
